intro: Leucoxylum, commonly known as the snowbell tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, often in shades of white or pale pink. The leaves are typically oval and arranged alternately along the stems. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They thrive in moist, acidic soils and are often found in woodland or shrubland habitats.
